Method Detail

createArrays

public static void createArrays(double[][] data)
Creates two arrays, test data and training data, based on the numbers generated by random 20. test data contains the data in the data array occoring at index numbers generated by randome20. Training data contains the other 80% of the data.

Parameters:
arrayindexes - this array contains the list of index numbers generated by Random20

findDistance

public static double findDistance(double[] array1,
                                  double[] array2)
Finds the distance between two tumors by using the distance formula, taking the difference between each of the 30 values, squaring them and then rooting the sum.

Parameters:
array1 - contains data for the 1st tumor
array2 - contains data for the 2nd tumor
Returns:
returns the distance between the two tumors.

findNearestNeighborAccuracy

public static double findNearestNeighborAccuracy(double[][] testdata,
                                                 double[][] trainingdata)
Finds the accuracy of the Nearest neighbor algorithm on this dataset

Parameters:
testdata - the array with data which needs to be checked
trainingdata - the array with training data used to predict the testdata
Returns:
the accuracy of the nearest neighbor algorithm on the dataset

getDistances

public static double[][] getDistances(int indexoftestdata)
finds the distance between a point in the test data and all points in training data.

Parameters:
indexoftestdata - the index of the point in test data
Returns:
a two array with distances between the point at indextestdata of testdata and all points in training data, as well as the classification of whether malignant or benign.

getNearestNeighborAccuracy

public static double getNearestNeighborAccuracy(double[][] data)
Gets the Accuracy of the Nearest Neighbor Algorithm, by calling the random20 method, the createArrays method and then the findNearestNeighborAccuracy method

Returns:
returns the accuracy of the nearest neighbor algorithm for one test

kNearestNeighbor

public static double kNearestNeighbor(int valueofk,
                                      double[][] data)
implements the kNearestNeighbor algorithm, to predict the value of a tumor, and finds the accuracy of the prediction.

Parameters:
valueofk - the value of k to use
Returns:
returns the accuracy of the algorithm for that value of k

random20

public static void random20()
Generates a random list of index numbers. These data occoring at these index numbers of the data array are put into the test data array.

sortDistances

public static double[][] sortDistances(double[][] arrayofdistances)
sorts an array using bubblesort. used to sort the array of distances in ascending order to be used to predict the value of a tumor in the kNearestNeighbor algorithm.

Parameters:
arrayofdistances - the 2-d array with classification of the tumor in the trainingdata and its distance from a tumor in the testdata array
Returns:
the 2-d array of distances and classification sorted in ascending order by distances.
